intro: Astronidium banksianum, commonly known as the Banksia Astronidium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Queensland, Australia, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage and its unique inflorescence, which consists of small, clustered flowers. It plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various native insects and birds. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
